definition[0]: giving all your attention to what is happening, being said etc
example[0]: The animal raised its head, suddenly alert.
example[1]: Taking notes is one of the best ways to stay alert in lectures.
definition[1]: able to think quickly and clearly
example[2]: Jack was as mentally alert as a man half his age.
definition[2]: to officially warn someone about a problem or danger so that they are ready to deal with it
example[3]: The school immediately alerted the police.
definition[3]: to make someone realize something important or dangerous
example[4]: campaigns to alert the public to the dangers of HIV
definition[4]: a warning to be ready for possible danger
example[5]: The bomb alert was raised soon after midnight.
